resources.string: Well done!\nYou found the 9 letter word!
An unexpected error has caused Jumblee to crash. Sorry for the inconvenience. \n\nA bug report has been sent and we hope to have it fixed soon.

Well that last game didn't go too well. 
You didn't find a single word. 
 
But I'm glad you're having another go.
Woah, you didn\'t find any words! \nHave another go, I\'m sure you can do better.

Well done! Your score of %1$.0f is %6$s. 
 
You found %2$d words out of %3$d (%4$.0f%%). 
At a rate of %5$.2f words per minute. 
 
Your score will be posted to our global scoreboard.
\nWould you also like to post it to Facebook?

Quitting so soon? 
Are you sure you're done?

Current version: %1$s-%2$d 
New Version: %3$s-%4$d 
Published on %5$s 
 
Install the new version?

We've tried our best to make Jumblee great. 
 
Since you've played it a few times now, 
we hope you think it's great too. 
 
If you come across any issues or ideas, 
let us know so we can get right on them. 
 
And if you do like it, rate it in the Android market. 
Let everyone know how good you think Jumblee is.

Jumblee was crafted with much love 
and care and took many months of work. 
 
The problem is, that it seems that this copy of Jumblee has been pirated. Which means that some bastard is profiting off my hard labour, and you have a version of Jumblee that can never be improved. 
 
To download a current, legitimate and FREE version of Jumblee, click on the appropriate button below.

Jumblee is a word game where you must find as many words of four or more letters in the allotted time. 
 
Each word must contain the central letter exactly once, while other tiles can be used no more than once. 
 
You start each game with 60 seconds and finding a new word increases that time by 20 seconds. 
 
The games ends when either: 
 - Time runs out, or 
 - You give up 
 
Scores are determined by both the percentageFound of words found and how quickly words are found. So find as many words as you can, as quickly as you can. 
 
Have fun.

I hate long boring legalese EULAs, so this isn't one. However, it's a still a license agreement between you and Xandar Pty Ltd for the use of Jumblee, but hopefully it's a bit more fun. 
 
 
I lease you this app, it won't cost a cent. 
But the content is mine, it's only yours to rent. 
 
You can give Jumblee to others, can't charge money. 
You can't disassemble or change it, that's not funny. 
 
I'll support you as best I can and charge no fees. 
You agree its a game. No liabilities, no warranties. 
 
I collect anon usage data, to make the game better. 
You agree to support this, as the end-user. 
 
Jumblee shows ads, cause I've got to eat. 
Rough (regional) location makes those ads great. 
 
You agree to show the ads, it's only fair. 
To pay for 6 months development and loss of hair. 
 
I don't store your location, or use it for aught else. 
If that ever changes I promise to ask first.

There aren't any Jumbles available at present. 
 
You've really been churning through them to run out. 
What's your percentageFound found? 
Think you'll make the world qualifier's with that? 
 
Anyway, more Jumbles are being generated. 
So be patient and you can get back to it in a minute. 
 
Glad to see you're so keen :-)
Version: %1$s-%2$d \nCreated by Xandar Mobility. \n(c) 2011 Xandar Mobility. All rights reserved.

A new version is available. 
Version %1$s-%2$d published on %3$s. 
 
Would you like to update?

We really hope you're enjoying playing Jumblee, but let us know what you think about the game.
 
 Good, bad or ugly, we'll listen.
 
 
 
 JumbleeVersion=%1$s-%2$d
 Phone=%3$s
 PhoneModel=%4$s
 AndroidVersion=%5$s

Jumblee can now post your scores to Facebook. 
 
To do so you must first authenticate with Facebook and grant Jumblee permission to 
- Access basic info 
 (Not used by Jumblee but required by every FB app) 
- Post to your wall 
- Access data anytime 
 (Jumblee will post later if you're not connected now)
The best 9 letter word puzzle game for Android, and its FREE.

Just racked up %6$s score of %1$.0f on Jumblee. 
Found %2$d out of %3$d words (%4$.0f%%) at %5$.2f words per minute. 
 
Beat that!

This is really embarrassing. I just played Jumblee and I didn't find a single word. 
What's worse, is that I decided to let you all know about it. 
 
But it's ok, next time I'm, going to do really well. I promise.

string-array.item: Improve your vocabulary. 100,000 puzzles to solve.
Improve your vocabulary. How many words can you find?
100,000 puzzles to solve. Can you find the 9 letter word?
100,000 puzzles to solve. How many words can you find?
How\'s your vocab? Scrabble practice perhaps? Or just burn some time keeping your mind sharp.
